atomic_tests.name: System Information Discovery
atomic_tests.description: Identify System Info. Upon execution, system info and time info will be displayed.

atomic_tests.name: System Information Discovery
atomic_tests.description: Identify System Info

atomic_tests.name: List OS Information
atomic_tests.description: Identify System Info

executor.name: sh
executor.command:
uname -a >> #{output_file}
if [ -f /etc/lsb-release ]; then cat /etc/lsb-release >> #{output_file}; fi
if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ]; then cat /etc/redhat-release >> #{output_file}; fi   
if [ -f /etc/issue ]; then cat /etc/issue >> #{output_file}; fi
if [ -f /etc/os-release ]; then cat /etc/os-release >> #{output_file}; fi
uptime >> #{output_file}
cat #{output_file} 2>/dev/null

output_file.description: Output file used to store the results.

atomic_tests.name: Linux VM Check via Hardware
atomic_tests.description: Identify virtual machine hardware. This technique is used by the Pupy RAT and other malware.

executor.name: bash
executor.command:
if [ -f /sys/class/dmi/id/bios_version ]; then cat /sys/class/dmi/id/bios_version | grep -i amazon; fi
if [ -f /sys/class/dmi/id/product_name ]; then cat /sys/class/dmi/id/product_name | grep -i "Droplet\|HVM\|VirtualBox\|VMware"; fi
if [ -f /sys/class/dmi/id/chassis_vendor ]; then cat /sys/class/dmi/id/chassis_vendor | grep -i "Xen\|Bochs\|QEMU"; fi
if [ -x "$(command -v dmidecode)" ]; then sudo dmidecode | grep -i "microsoft\|vmware\|virtualbox\|quemu\|domu"; fi
if [ -f /proc/scsi/scsi ]; then cat /proc/scsi/scsi | grep -i "vmware\|vbox"; fi
if [ -f /proc/ide/hd0/model ]; then cat /proc/ide/hd0/model | grep -i "vmware\|vbox\|qemu\|virtual"; fi
if [ -x "$(command -v lspci)" ]; then sudo lspci | grep -i "vmware\|virtualbox"; fi
if [ -x "$(command -v lscpu)" ]; then sudo lscpu | grep -i "Xen\|KVM\|Microsoft"; fi

atomic_tests.name: Linux VM Check via Kernel Modules
atomic_tests.description: Identify virtual machine guest kernel modules. This technique is used by the Pupy RAT and other malware.

executor.name: bash
executor.command:
sudo lsmod | grep -i "vboxsf\|vboxguest"
sudo lsmod | grep -i "vmw_baloon\|vmxnet"
sudo lsmod | grep -i "xen-vbd\|xen-vnif"
sudo lsmod | grep -i "virtio_pci\|virtio_net"
sudo lsmod | grep -i "hv_vmbus\|hv_blkvsc\|hv_netvsc\|hv_utils\|hv_storvsc"

atomic_tests.name: FreeBSD VM Check via Kernel Modules
atomic_tests.description: Identify virtual machine host kernel modules.

atomic_tests.name: Hostname Discovery (Windows)
atomic_tests.description: Identify system hostname for Windows. Upon execution, the hostname of the device will be displayed.

atomic_tests.name: Hostname Discovery
atomic_tests.description: Identify system hostname for FreeBSD, Linux and macOS systems.

atomic_tests.name: Windows MachineGUID Discovery
atomic_tests.description: Identify the Windows MachineGUID value for a system. Upon execution, the machine GUID will be displayed from registry.

atomic_tests.name: Griffon Recon
atomic_tests.description:
This script emulates the reconnaissance script seen in used by Griffon and was modified by security researcher Kirk Sayre 
in order simply print the recon results to the screen as opposed to exfiltrating them. [Script](https://gist.github.com/kirk-sayre-work/7cb5bf4e2c7c77fa5684ddc17053f1e5).  
For more information see also [https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/js.griffon](https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/js.griffon) and [https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0417/](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0417/)

dependencies.description: Sample script file must exist on disk at specified location (#{vbscript})

atomic_tests.name: Environment variables discovery on windows
atomic_tests.description: Identify all environment variables. Upon execution, environments variables and your path info will be displayed.

atomic_tests.name: Environment variables discovery on freebsd, macos and linux
atomic_tests.description: Identify all environment variables. Upon execution, environments variables and your path info will be displayed.

atomic_tests.name: Show System Integrity Protection status (MacOS)
atomic_tests.description: Read and Display System Intergrety Protection status. csrutil is commonly used by malware and post-exploitation tools to determine whether certain files and directories on the system are writable or not.

atomic_tests.description: Discover Local Privilege Escalation possibilities using winPEAS function of WinPwn

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - itm4nprivesc
atomic_tests.description: Discover Local Privilege Escalation possibilities using itm4nprivesc function of WinPwn

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - Powersploits privesc checks
atomic_tests.description: Powersploits privesc checks using oldchecks function of WinPwn

executor.name: powershell
executor.cleanup_command:
rm -force -recurse .\DomainRecon -ErrorAction Ignore
rm -force -recurse .\Exploitation -ErrorAction Ignore
rm -force -recurse .\LocalPrivEsc -ErrorAction Ignore
rm -force -recurse .\LocalRecon -ErrorAction Ignore
rm -force -recurse .\Vulnerabilities -ErrorAction Ignore

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - General privesc checks
atomic_tests.description: General privesc checks using the otherchecks function of WinPwn

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - GeneralRecon
atomic_tests.description: Collect general computer informations via GeneralRecon function of WinPwn

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - Morerecon
atomic_tests.description: Gathers local system information using the Morerecon function of WinPwn

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - RBCD-Check
atomic_tests.description: Search for Resource-Based Constrained Delegation attack paths using RBCD-Check function of WinPwn

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - PowerSharpPack - Watson searching for missing windows patches
atomic_tests.description: PowerSharpPack - Watson searching for missing windows patches  technique via function of WinPwn

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - PowerSharpPack - Sharpup checking common Privesc vectors
atomic_tests.description: PowerSharpPack - Sharpup checking common Privesc vectors technique via function of WinPwn - Takes several minutes to complete.

atomic_tests.name: WinPwn - PowerSharpPack - Seatbelt
atomic_tests.description:
PowerSharpPack - Seatbelt technique via function of WinPwn.

[Seatbelt](https://github.com/GhostPack/Seatbelt) is a C# project that performs a number of security oriented host-survey "safety checks" relevant from both offensive and defensive security perspectives.

atomic_tests.name: Azure Security Scan with SkyArk
atomic_tests.description:
Upon successful execution, this test will utilize a valid read-only Azure AD user's credentials to conduct a security scan and determine what users exist in a given tenant, as well as identify any admin users. 
Once the test is complete, a folder will be output to the temp directory that contains 3 csv files which provide info on the discovered users. 
See https://github.com/cyberark/SkyArk

executor.name: powershell
executor.command:
Import-Module "PathToAtomicsFolder\..\ExternalPayloads\AzureStealth.ps1" -force      
$Password = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "#{password}" -AsPlainText -Force
$Credential = New-Object -TypeName System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList "#{username}", $Password
Connect-AzAccount -Credential $Credential
Connect-AzureAD -Credential $Credential
Scan-AzureAdmins -UseCurrentCred

dependencies.description: The SkyArk AzureStealth module must exist in PathToAtomicsFolder\..\ExternalPayloads.
The AzureAD module must be installed.
The Az module must be installed.

atomic_tests.name: Linux List Kernel Modules
atomic_tests.description: Enumerate kernel modules installed 3 different ways. Upon successful execution stdout will display kernel modules installed on host 2 times, followed by list of modules matching 'vmw' if present.

atomic_tests.name: FreeBSD List Kernel Modules
atomic_tests.description: Enumerate kernel modules loaded. Upon successful execution stdout will display kernel modules loaded, followed by list of modules matching 'vmm' if present.

atomic_tests.name: System Information Discovery with WMIC
atomic_tests.description:
Identify system information with the WMI command-line (WMIC) utility. Upon execution, various system information will be displayed, including: OS, CPU, GPU, and disk drive names; memory capacity; display resolution; and baseboard, BIOS, and GPU driver products/versions.
https://nwgat.ninja/getting-system-information-with-wmic-on-windows/
Elements of this test were observed in the wild used by Aurora Stealer in late 2022 and early 2023, as highlighted in public reporting:
https://blog.sekoia.io/aurora-a-rising-stealer-flying-under-the-radar
https://blog.cyble.com/2023/01/18/aurora-a-stealer-using-shapeshifting-tactics/

executor.name: command_prompt
executor.command:
wmic cpu get name
wmic MEMPHYSICAL get MaxCapacity
wmic baseboard get product
wmic baseboard get version
wmic bios get SMBIOSBIOSVersion
wmic path win32_VideoController get name
wmic path win32_VideoController get DriverVersion
wmic path win32_VideoController get VideoModeDescription
wmic OS get Caption,OSArchitecture,Version
wmic DISKDRIVE get Caption
Get-WmiObject win32_bios

atomic_tests.name: System Information Discovery
atomic_tests.description: The script gathernetworkinfo.vbs is employed to collect system information such as the operating system, DNS details, firewall configuration, etc. Outputs are stored in c:\Windows\System32\config or c:\Windows\System32\reg. https://www.verboon.info/2011/06/the-gathernetworkinfo-vbs-script/

atomic_tests.name: Check computer location
atomic_tests.description:
Looks up country code configured in the registry, likely geofence. Upon execution, country code info will be displayed.
- https://tria.ge/210111-eaz8mqhgh6/behavioral1

atomic_tests.name: BIOS Information Discovery through Registry
atomic_tests.description:
Looks up for BIOS information in the registry. BIOS information is often read in order to detect sandboxing environments.  Upon execution, BIOS information will be displayed.
- https://tria.ge/210111-eaz8mqhgh6/behavioral1
- https://evasions.checkpoint.com/techniques/registry.html

executor.name: command_prompt
executor.command:
reg query HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\HARDWARE\DESCRIPTION\System /v SystemBiosVersion
reg query HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\HARDWARE\DESCRIPTION\System /v VideoBiosVersion

atomic_tests.name: ESXi - VM Discovery using ESXCLI
atomic_tests.description:
An adversary will using ESXCLI to enumerate the Virtual Machines on the host prior to executing power off routine.
[Reference](https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/hypervisor-jackpotting-ecrime-actors-increase-targeting-of-esxi-servers/)

vm_host.description: Specify the host name or IP of the ESXi Server

vm_user.description: Specify the privilege user account on ESXi Server

vm_pass.description: Specify the privilege user password on ESXi Server

cli_script.description: Path to file with discovery commands

atomic_tests.name: ESXi - Darkside system information discovery
atomic_tests.description:
Darkside ransomware utilises various ESXCLI commands to obtain information about the ESXi Host.
[Reference](https://www.trendmicro.com/en_ph/research/21/e/darkside-linux-vms-targeted.html)

vm_host.description: Specify the host name or IP of the ESXi Server

vm_user.description: Specify the privilege user account on ESXi Server

vm_pass.description: Specify the privilege user password on ESXi Server

cli_script.description: Path to file containing darkside ransomware discovery commands

atomic_tests.name: sysctl to gather macOS hardware info
atomic_tests.description: Gets the macOS hardware information, which can be used to determine whether the target macOS host is running on a physical or virtual machine. sysctl can be used to gather interesting macOS host data, including hardware information, memory size, logical cpu information, etc.

atomic_tests.name: operating system discovery
atomic_tests.description:
operating system discovery using get-ciminstance
https://petri.com/getting-operating-system-information-powershell/

executor.name: powershell
executor.command: Get-CimInstance Win32_OperatingSystem | Select-Object Caption, Version, ServicePackMajorVersion, OSArchitecture, CSName, WindowsDirectory | Out-null

atomic_tests.name: Check OS version via "ver" command
atomic_tests.description: Ver command shows information about os version.

atomic_tests.name: Display volume shadow copies with "vssadmin"
atomic_tests.description: The command shows all available volume shadow copies, along with their creation time and location.

atomic_tests.name: Identify System Locale and Regional Settings with PowerShell
atomic_tests.description:
This action demonstrates how an attacker might gather a system's region and language settings using PowerShell, which could aid in profiling 
the machine's location and user language preferences. The command outputs system locale details to a temporary file for further analysis.

atomic_tests.name: Enumerate Available Drives via gdr
atomic_tests.description: This test simulates an attacker attempting to list the available drives on the system to gather data about file storage locations.

atomic_tests.name: Discover OS Product Name via Registry
atomic_tests.description:
Identify the Operating System Product Name via registry with the reg.exe command.
Upon execution, the OS Product Name will be displayed.

atomic_tests.name: Discover OS Build Number via Registry
atomic_tests.description:
Identify the Operating System Build Number via registry with the reg.exe command.
Upon execution, the OS Build Number will be displayed.
